alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:36AM EST until December 20 at 1:45AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Ramapo River At Pompton Lakes affecting Morris, Passaic and Bergen Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Pompton Lakes...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River at Pompton Lakes. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Nuisance, low lying flooding, occurs near the dam in the Pompton Lakes. At 11.5 feet, South section of Pompton Lakes experiences flooding. At 12.5 feet, Several residences in Pompton Lakes, along Riveredge Drive, take on water. At 13.5 feet, Hamburg Turnpike is closed between Route 202 and Riverview Road. Many residences are flooded south of Dawes Highway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Tuesday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 9.1 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 12/24/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Ramapo River Pompton Lakes 11.5 13.0 Tue 11 a 9.9 9.4 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM EST.
